intro: Trollius ledebourii var. polysepalus, commonly known as the many-sepal globeflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its showy, yellow, globe-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features basal leaves that are broadly ovate to spoon-shaped. Its flowers consist of numerous sepals that are often mistaken for petals, giving it a unique appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats.
